{"step_by_step_thinking": "The pulp proper is the central part of the dental pulp. According to Document [20], it contains many cells and an extensive vascular supply. This suggests that it contains fine nerve fibers and blood vessels (Choice B). Document [15] also mentions that the pulp proper has a rich vascular and nerve supply. Document [20] also mentions that the pulp proper contains fibroblasts and undifferentiated mesenchymal cells, which are multipotent cells (Choice C). Document [2] describes the pulp as a part of the dentin–pulp complex and is made up of living connective tissues (Choice A). Therefore, all the choices are correct.", "answer_choice": "D"}
